articles.headline: Seeking to Ride on China’s Stock Market Highs
articles.snippet: Risks abound for ordinary citizens who are piling into the stock markets at a pace not seen since 2007.
articles.abstract: Risks abound for ordinary citizens who are piling into the stock markets at a pace not seen since 2007.
articles.lead_paragraph: Kuang Qingming, a banker in Beijing, made a snap investment decision this fall.
articles.byline: By Neil Gough and Cao Li

articles.headline: Court Filing Illuminates Morgan Stanley Role in Lending
articles.snippet: Emails and documents filed in court provide a look at the extent to which Morgan Stanley influenced New Century’s push into riskier mortgages in the run-up to the financial crisis.
articles.abstract: Emails and documents filed in court provide a look at the extent to which Morgan Stanley influenced New Century’s push into riskier mortgages in the run-up to the financial crisis.
articles.lead_paragraph: Since the financial crisis, Wall Street firms have argued that they were victims, just like everybody else, of the bad mortgages that were churned out by subprime lenders like Countrywide and New Century.

articles.headline: Success of Kentucky’s Health Plan Comes With New Obstacles
articles.snippet: A poor state with a starkly unhealthy populace, Kentucky is becoming a symbol of the Affordable Health Care Act’s potential, and its obstacles.
articles.abstract: A poor state with a starkly unhealthy populace, Kentucky is becoming a symbol of the Affordable Health Care Act’s potential, and its obstacles.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOUISVILLE, Ky. — In many ways, Kentucky, a poor state with a starkly unhealthy populace, has become a symbol of the Affordable Care Act’s potential.

articles.headline: Greek Patience With Austerity Nears Its Limit
articles.snippet: The vast majority of Greeks are still experiencing the hardships of reform, with little evidence that the measures are working.
articles.abstract: The vast majority of Greeks are still experiencing the hardships of reform, with little evidence that the measures are working.
articles.lead_paragraph: NEA IONIA, Greece — Alexandra Nikolovieni, 55, lost her job escorting young children on a school bus four years ago and has not been able to find another one since. To help financially, her daughter and her son-in-law, who have two children, moved into her house. But now they have lost their jobs, too.

articles.headline: Hurdle in Hunt for Missing Jet: Tracking System
articles.snippet: As the search for AirAsia’s Flight 8501 continued, aviation experts said the difficulty in locating it underscored the limitations in how planes are tracked.
articles.abstract: As the search for AirAsia’s Flight 8501 continued, aviation experts said the difficulty in locating it underscored the limitations in how planes are tracked.
articles.lead_paragraph: Just nine months after a Malaysia Airlines flight vanished, the puzzling loss of another passenger plane once again has highlighted an urgent question: How can modern jetliners simply disappear in today’s hyper-connected world?

articles.headline: Victims of G.M. Deadly Defect Fall Through Legal Cracks
articles.snippet: The experience of some accident victims and their families shows that opportunities to raise public alarm bells about defective ignition switches were sometimes lost.
articles.abstract: The experience of some accident victims and their families shows that opportunities to raise public alarm bells about defective ignition switches were sometimes lost.
articles.lead_paragraph: The law firm was unequivocal. It refused to take the case against General Motors involving a car crash that killed 18-year-old Natasha Weigel, saying that the value of her life in a lawsuit was too small to justify the expense and risk of litigation.
articles.byline: By Barry Meier and Hilary Stout

articles.headline: Gathering Bedfellows, Odd and Otherwise, for Auld Lang Syne
articles.snippet: Toasting and roasting the guests we’d like to invite for our annual DealBook “Closing Dinner.”
articles.abstract: Toasting and roasting the guests we’d like to invite for our annual DealBook “Closing Dinner.”
articles.lead_paragraph: Dinner is about to begin. Please, take your seats.
